meanings.definition: Preworks (verb): to prepare or plan in advance
meanings.sent1: She always preworks her presentations to ensure they go smoothly.
meanings.sent2: It is important to preworks your schedule before starting a busy week.
meanings.sent3: John decided to preworks his camping trip by packing extra marshmallows.
meanings.sent4: The chef preworks the ingredients like a conductor preparing for a symphony.
meanings.sent5: Preworking your route can help you avoid traffic and delays.

meanings.definition: Preworks (noun): preliminary tasks or preparations before a main project or event
meanings.sent1: The team completed all the preworks before launching the new product.
meanings.sent2: Make sure you do the preworks thoroughly to avoid any last-minute issues.
meanings.sent3: The preworks for the party included decorating the venue and setting up the music.
meanings.sent4: The preworks are like the foundation of a building, essential for a successful outcome.
meanings.sent5: Completing the preworks early allowed them to focus on the main project without stress.
